text: Edwin Clark (May 25, 1927 - February 17, 2025), also known as Edwin Kiagbodo Clark, was a Nigerian nationalist, Ijaw national leader and politician. He served under the administrations of the military governor Samuel Ogbemudia and head of state, General Yakubu Gowon between 1966 and 1975. In 1966, he was part of an advisory committee to the military governor of the Mid-Western Region province, David Ejoor and became Federal Commissioner of Information in 1975. Clark was an unofficial adviser to President Goodluck Jonathan. He was a philanthropist who founded the Edwin Clark Foundation and established a university in his hometown in 2015. ==Death== Clark died on February 17, 2025, at the age of 97 due to natural cause. Former president of Nigeria Olusegun Obasanjo described Clark as a "great brother, friend, a frontline lawyer and seasoned economist". ==References== ==Further reading== * * Category:1927 births Category:2025 deaths Category:Nigerian politicians Category:People from Delta State
